description.narrative: The ‘Gender Bizness’ project in Sierra Leone implemented by Save the Children UK aims to develop and test a replicable, holistic and effective approach to reduce teenage pregnancy and support vulnerable youth in urban Sierra Leone. The project has four objectives which seeks to (a) engage adolescents aged 15-19 years and youth aged 20-24 years challenge social and gender norms that influence adolescent pregnancy; (b) increase uptake and sustained utilisation of Sexual Reproductive Health and Gender-Based Violence information, services and justice among girls, boys, women, and men; (c) economically empower households to prevent coping strategies that place girls at risk of adolescent pregnancy; (d) enhance the institutional capacity of 4 civil society organisations to deliver similar programming outside of this project and 2 government agencies have enhanced capacity to deliver on their mandates. The key activities include technical support for adaptive programming, conduct exploratory research, strengthening the delivery of ARSH services, provision of legal and psychosocial services and COVID-19 prevention and is delivered in partnership with local NGOs namely CAN, PPASL, ADVOCAID and Rainbo Initiative.
